citations.narrative:
Review of Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) meeting minutes revealed an incident report
documenting a coyote attack on a goat herd. The veterinarian assigned to Vet Med Park discussed the incident at the
time of inspection. On the evening of February 9, 2023, in the Buffalo Pasture at Vet Med Park, a student worker found
coyotes attacking the does (female goats) that are used for teaching. The coyotes ran off and the student contacted the
veterinarian. Upon arrival (within 30 minutes), the veterinarian determined three does were attacked with the following
outcome: one doe was dead, one was severely injured and later euthanized, and the other was treated and recovered.
The rest of the goats were evaluated and moved to a safer pen. Failure of outdoor housing facilities to protect the animals
from injury can negatively impact the health and well-being of the animals. The outdoor housing facilities must be
structurally sound and be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury. The facility implemented corrective
actions after the incident by keeping the animals in pens closer to the main facility/humans and purchasing two trained
goat-protecting dogs who now live with the goats full-time.
Correct by: August 10, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
Review of Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) meeting minutes revealed an incident report 
documenting a coyote attack on a goat herd. The veterinarian assigned to Vet Med Park discussed the incident at the 
time of inspection. On the evening of February 9, 2023, in the Buffalo Pasture at Vet Med Park, a student worker found 
coyotes attacking the does (female goats) that are used for teaching. The coyotes ran off and the student contacted the 
veterinarian. Upon arrival (within 30 minutes), the veterinarian determined three does were attacked with the following 
outcome: one doe was dead, one was severely injured and later euthanized, and the other was treated and recovered. 
The rest of the goats were evaluated and moved to a safer pen. Failure of outdoor housing facilities to protect the animals 
from injury can negatively impact the health and well-being of the animals. The outdoor housing facilities must be 
structurally sound and be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury. The facility implemented corrective 
actions after the incident by keeping the animals in pens closer to the main facility/humans and purchasing two trained 
goat-protecting dogs who now live with the goats full-time.  
 
Correct by: August 10, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
